description: This is my new favorite crab restaurant! Crazy good crab rolls on vermicelli and great spicy beef soup!
author: Seth G.

description: They serve some good crab tomato soup and egg rolls.  This is a small family owned restaurant so the service is slow paced but the portion is generous.
author: Aylee G.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE. So firstly, I'm a little bit obsessed with Asian food, especially Vietnamese. My go-to dish is Pork Vermicelli w/ Imperial Roll (Bún Thot Nong) which is 10$ on the dot. It's simple, yummy, and comes with lots of fresh veggies that I love, grilled pork, and a crispy Imperial Roll. 

This place by far has the BEST IMPERIAL ROLLS I'VE EVER EATEN. One if the women that works there told me that they hand make their rice paper for the rolls which is what makes them so good. I don't know how they do it but the texture is unlike any imperial roll or egg roll I've ever had...and it's amazing. 

The staff here is pretty timid, but friendly, and the food is decently priced. Be careful trying to stop by here if it's close to closing time - if they aren't busy sometimes they will close early. 

Two things to note:

- Ambience is pretty non-existent, not fancy at all, sometimes there isn't even music playing. Definitely not the right place if you're looking for romance, but maybe you can order it to-go and take it home for a romantic evening because the food is BOMB.

- There is a 13$ minimum for credit cards, with a $0.50 fee if you're under that. Also tax is included in the prices so that's kind of nice...
author: Taylor D.

description: First time here.... it is EMPTY! Decent service and nice interior. Their bon bo hue is very spicy and yummy  may come back in the future
author: Lulu L.

description:
NEVER EAT HERE EVER - BAD BUSINESS PRACTICES !!! I reported them to the BBB and San Francisco DPH

First things first I had not one HAIR in my shrimp spring roll, a second spring roll had a hair peeking out the end where you would start to eat !! I took a photo of it and will post on this page. 

Second thing was the young lady charged me $1.50 for a menu price .99 cent can soda saying that's the price after tax. For the grilled shrimp over rice she charged me $10 menu price is $9.20 also saying that's the price after tax !!! The shrimp spring roll menu price was $5.90 but she charged me $7 !!!!

I demanded a full refund and caused such a commotion that the persons in the restaurant decided to leave !!

You've been warned
author: Rudy S.

description: Wow amazing and delicious food  very please with everything. The shrimp rice was like a  bombshell in your mouth and the pho soup was 100 % delicious and of course my sandwich was yummy.
author: Paula Z.

description: I love Pho and I have had it many times from many restaurants. I stopped here on a wim that I would find comfort in a hot bowl of traditional beef Pho. Instead my noodles were cooked until very soft and when I tasted the broth. I thought I would find anise and cinnamon but found none. Sadly I tried to add chilli and hoisin but it could not hide the bland flavor of an empty beef broth.  I had to ask for some basil as they did not serve the soup with the traditional basil, chards and bean sprouts so I only got noodles. I'll keep looking for a phone spot with an awesome broth. This is not it
author: Serena R.

description:
I don't know why this place only has three stars because my first meal here was exceptional. I've always drove past it but finally decided to give it a try. I got the fresh spring rolls and the pho with steak. I must say they do a great job with the food presentation. The spring rolls were rolled in a cute way where the lettuce was sticking out and they were even placed neatly on a plate. Not only did they look good but they also tasted good. 

For the pho, I asked for the steak on the side. When my order came, each slice of steak was nearly and  individually folded too! When I was ordering, I was a bit skeptical because the pho was almost eight dollars. But when the food came out, it made sense considering how large the bowl of pho was. I was also very satisfied with how much steak I received.

I thought the broth was so delicious and oh not the mention the noodles. Usually pho comes with the skinny rice noodles but this pho had the fat flat rice noodles. I felt like it made the pho so much better. Definitely can't wait to come back. The only downside might be that there were not a lot of options on the menu but I don't like having too many options anyway.
author: Annie H.

description: Food was good, ordered shrimp spring rolls and it had daikon in them and the vegetables were clean. Ordered the pho dac biet and it was yummy, and the stir fry. The place was clean and our order came out very quickly and tasted on par with the price.
author: Marcus P.

description:
The first thing i see on the menu here is Pho Dac Biet Ha Noi
And I'm looking at it with a semi surprised notion goong through my head since many vietnamese places don't outright advertise that they sell Northern Style Pho unless your family's patronized that establishment for decades or you happen to know someone who has eaten or worked there before.

Hell even Yelp can't tell the difference.
The place on the inside is alot cleaner than Pho The Goi in Westborough(I'd be amazed if PTG is still around)

Because its dimly lit on the inside it can sometimes come off as if it was closed when it is actually open. Even with only 1 waitress and 1 cook on staff during my visit? They still were able to match Kevins Noodle house for speed even though there were 5 other tables filled to capacity.

The good news is. There were no flying bowls or flying chopsticks so by no means is the food terrible or inedible.
I didn't get dehydrated or have that tingly feel on my tongue or throat so quality wise. Everything seems to be in order.

The bad news. Parking can be a bitch and some of the characters who loiter  the area make you feel like its another level in GTA III. Unless you get lucky on Alemany or  mission near mcdonalds. Most of the parking is further down on Paris street.

I wouldn't mind coming here. I just think they need to lighten up the place so when we come by. We are not worried that it is closed.
author: Eric C.

description: One of the best Pho places I have been to. The waitress was very knowledgeable of the menu items and the chef was a pro at crafting some amazing food. The drinks weren't bad either! Would definitely recommend!
author: Sam I.

description: What's not to love? Great location, reasonable price, delicious food, absolutely no pretense... you can watch the news with your boyfriend while sharing the Imperial Rolls! I'm especially fond of the veggie Pho, and have eaten it twice already this week.
author: Trixie R.

description: Service was awesome I was greeted as i walked in as were all the people behind me. The waitress was nice enough to let me know that this place serves northern style pho which is amazing i got a pho tai and thai tea. Thai tea was amazing had to order another on the way out. Worth the trip to the city in my opinion.
author: Jalisa G.

description:
This is a hidden gem of Excelcior neighborhood! They make the best imperial rolls (fried rolls) you never can find at anywhere else. The rolls are filled with more than 24 ingredients, made with rice paper wrapper instead of egg paper like the generic way. I would highly recommend their unique special imperial rolls! 

Not to mention sometimes you come and the rolls are sold out! And there is a waitress who plays a traditional Vietnamese instrument. I don't think you can have this kinda experience at any other Vietnamese restaurants. Super pleasant experience at Pho Nice! Thank you!
author: KI P.

description: This place has spectacular food amazing friendly service and everything is super fresh my favorite Pho spot in all the city!
author: DJ S.

description: Came here for dinner with my little one. We shared some Pho and some fried rice. Good hospitality. Yummy food. Decent prices. I will be back o_O
author: Cindyjo O.

description: Amazing food, great service, and nice location. What else can you ask for in a Vietnamese restaurant? The only thing that bothers me is the parking but other than that, it's great. Some of my favorites on the menu are the imperial rolls and the bún bò huê (spicy beef noodle). The flavor just explodes in your mouth and hits the spot when you're hungry. I find the atmosphere of the restaurant very authentic. Their style is served just how it would be if you were actually in Vietnam, which makes this restaurant different from all the other ones in the city. The food is definitely worth the money. The hours are pretty good too. I love coming here on evenings when it's cold.
author: Mary Lourdes M.

description:
My boyfriend and I were in the area and I was craving imperial rolls so we decided to stop by. We ordered vermicelli with grilled pork and imperial rolls and an appetizer of more imperial rolls. Lol I'm very pregnant and really wanted imperial rolls. Anyways the young lady lets us know they are out of imperial rolls so they will have to prepare and make a fresh batch and it will take longer. I didn't mind the wait. She then came out and said they were out of vermicelli noodles! What Vietnamese place doesn't have vermicelli!? She said if she could substitute with rice and I mean it becomes a totally different plate but we said ok. 

The imperial rolls were a solid 3/5. They didn't have that flavor fullness that most have but we're very crunchy and overall okay.

The grilled pork was 4/5. But the portion was soooo small. 

We went to the register to pay and it was strange to me that the bill was exactly $24. I double checked and it seemed like she rounded the taxes, it's not that I couldn't pay them I just asked why she did that. She proceeded to try and tell me that she was bad at math but I calculated wrong? I just ignored it and gave her my credit card. Then she asked if I lived around there or worked around there. I said no. She commented about how it was weird that we came in and how they don't advertise their restaurant. Idk. 

Overall there was an unprofessional vibe and the food wasn't good enough to come back to.
author: Cece K.

description: This place is pretty good for me so far. Ordered the seafood combination noodle soup and I loved it. The broth made the noodles taste really really good. I just burnt my tongue a little from enjoying the sensation of the Pho. I like the decor and the window view here. It all seems pretty nice. I've noticed that the jalapeño and lime was dry, but that doesn't stop me from eating. I've also noticed they didn't offer cilantro or bean sprouts. I was a bit concerned, though I was okay with it. The waitress was nice, asked if we were okay once and helped direct me to the bathroom. I'm not sure if the bathroom has lighting, and was wondering why they left a chair preventing the door from closing. But overall the experience was pretty awesome and tasty :)
author: Kevin C.

description:
North Vietnamese style.
Therefore, its not your typical pho place. Even I'm not use to it.

Pho Nice took over a previous Pho place and I'm super glad. They had totally bad customer service. Anyway, here the customer service is great! The workers here don't speak much English so that can be a problem. They are also very reserved and timid. 

Regular Pho - Different type of noodles. The noodles are flat. The broth is much more different than the "south Vietnamese" type of broth. What is odd about this place is that they don't serve condiments such as cilantro and lemon like all typical pho places.

Hai Noi Bun is pretty much on point. The lettuce is fresh and the noodles are cooked to perfection. They also gave an abundance of meat. The presentation was also beautiful. 

Bun Bo Hue (emphasis on the hue, you vietnamese people would probably get the joke) - Broth is super sweet. A bit too much oil in the broth. After a few sips of the broth, I grew to like the sweetness of the soup. 

Definitely will be coming back when I'm craving for northern Vietnamese style pho and dishes because has great service and a clean place.
author: Kathleen U.

description: This place locks the door by 9pm even though the hours on yelp states it should open till 9:30, employee just looks at me while i walk away. this part of San Francisco is dead at night, if you are in the mood for pho either go downtown or go during the day i guess
author: Alexandru D.

description: The pho here is really good. Great flavors. Price is reasonable too. The only negative is the parking is difficult to find.
author: leo t.

description: Came inside and ordered my Pho to go. Like other said it is pretty dim inside. Ordered the special beef Pho first one on the list. The lady that took my order was nice and 10 mins later i got my food. Food taste good and I will return to taste the rest of the menu. FYI parking does sucks here so Good luck.
author: Clyde E.

description:
Its been so long since I've written a yelp review!!! May as well start with the revamped pho place down my street! 

My friends LOVE this place. I wouldn't even have known of their existence if they didn't drag me over here since I'm not the biggest fan of pho. They don't have shrimp pho on the menu but they happily accommodated! Its different from other pho places since its from another region. They don't serve it with bean sprouts and all those other typical pho toppings. 

Service could be improved. We tried coming here this past weekend but as soon as we walked in they said it was closed since I guess its a family owned restaurant and one of the girls was graduating that day. 

Its definitely an improvement from the old place and they finally got new signs up alerting the public its newly owned! Oh and my friend loves how they clean their shrimp here, you know, if you care about that kind of stuff.
author: Tiffany V.

description: This place has fully improved their services.  The food is also amazing and a must try
author: Paul T.

description:
Ok so I just got the Pho to go and I have to admit...its the worst Pho I've ever had in my life. It was lukewarm to start. Only a 4 block walk and it was not even cold outside.

I asked if they put basil with it but they seem so high and mighty to only offer cilantro with it. NO bean sprouts, NO basil, NO garlic. So it was like water basically. I've had better canned soup. I placed it downstairs on the bus stop so hopefully someone has a horrible but filling meal tonight.

They may try to call it "northern style" but I am sorry guys you can't get away by calling it that. Its called: CHEAP RESTAURANT MANAGER DOT COM.

The imperial rolls were literally dripping with grease, see foto. The shrimp rolls would of been decent....except it was served with peanut water. Yes they are so cheap they water down the peanut sauce. It is horrible. See video. All to save a buck? Wow. Lame! The imperial rolls came with no sauce...or wait were we supposed to dip them in the grease? Oh.

I cannot believe there is no basil!!!!!!! Seeing how stupid some business owners can be really makes me want to start one of my own. I think ANYONE could serve better Pho. Blindfolded.

Worst $22 I ever lost. Hire someone who knows how to run a bloody restaurant!
author: Silicon W.

description:
We just moved to the neighborhood and I thought I'd give this place a try since I drive by it all the time. I want to support any local businesses but unfortunately, I won't be coming back. I was really hoping for a good vietnamese restaurant that I could walk to.

I ordered the rare beef pho and when it came, it had a strange smell that pho shouldn't have. (I wondered who was cooking in the kitchen) They did bring the slice of lime but what was missing was the accompaning plate of herbs and bean sprouts. I've never eaten pho with only the noodles and the meat. How strange but I wanted to give the dish a chance. 

Big disappointment. You shouldn't have to eat "naked" pho like this!

Even tried to cover the lack of flavor with hoisen sauce. No joy. Sorry to have to give this place a one star. It made me feel so guilty to spend $10 on several bites of a bad dish and 10 minutes of my time. There's better places to spend you hard earned money.
author: Hieu D.

description: Really good location, right there on Geneva and Mission. So when you're hungry once you get off the bus, come by and visit this place. All family owned, really sweet people. North Vietnamese cuisine, their pho is off the hook! Quiet place, really nice decor if you're into that kinda stuff.
author: Jenn N.

description:
So good! They have the thick pho noodles here. Their imperial rolls are on point.
Beef stew egg noodles are a must try if you like savory.
Sometimes they have the shaken beef rice plate as a special and I die a little inside when they have it.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Don't know what you phools are talkin about with your single star reviews(I'm pretty sure you were reviewing the previous pho restaurant).This is north vietnamese style pho so grow a lil culture. 

I come here religiously for the rare beef pho and papaya salad(Yummm). I also enjoy their shrimp spring rolls which are really fresh and light. The service is friendly and quick.This is a family run business with 3 generations in the kitchen.
author: Chad B.

description: I usually don't write reviews, but this place is so BAD that I feel sorry for next person who walks in. It's a total abomination! The broth was bland. No flavor and tasted like watered down soup. You could tell their jalapeños aren't fresh because they're  dried and shriveled. You don't get the usual plate of cilantro and bean sprouts that goes with your pho. I wanted to add fish sauce to make "broth" a bit more bearable but even that isn't readily available. You have to go up front and ask for it and they're really stingy about the amount they give. Truly it was a depressing meal. I've been here once before and didn't like it but came back thinking they'd improve. I regret giving them the benefit of doubt
author: Cecilia T.

description:
Bland. Plus the pho is not served with the traditional accompaniments of herbs and bean sprouts. I spent  a month traveling all over Vietnam and everywhere I went, there was always these accompaniments. Over all very disappointing. 
  There are lots of places to get good pho, this is not one of them.
author: schmoo l.

description:
Got stir fried noodles. Tried both the shrimp and chicken one on different occasions. Shrimp plate was good. Super simple. parsley, noodles, shrimp. I got the chicken one the second time. It was a lot greasier (from the chicken) I can tell the chicken was precooked from their some chicken steak or something and probably a day or two older than what I would like. 

Overall I would go back here, cause its pretty cheap for a meal (no tax) but I'd be careful on what I order. As an example for comparison, my girlfriend got the same dish twice and tasted inconsistencies as well for her chicken and rice noodle soup. (first time good, second time not so much). Be careful what you order!

Service was alright.
author: Jason S.

description:
I've tried this place a few times now, both take out and sit down.  Cutesy name. 

Food = Good presentation. Piping hot. Delicious. (And they separate out the broth from the noodles, vegetables, etc. when you order to-go).

I've tried their pho, chicken pho, and rice plates.  All have been full of flavor, good seasoning and piping hot.  I'm a big fan of their chicken soup (especially when under the weather). 

Service = friendly. English isn't their first language, so be patient and repeat yourself, if need be.

Prices = moderate.
author: Fannie S.

description:
We stayed away for many months after being charged a higher price than was on the --allegedly-- out-of-date menu. I gave it another whirl today, with poor results. 

Water came in a thrice-cracked plastic cup. Tea came not at all. 

The highlight was the delicate shrimp papaya salad. Finely shredded green papaya, finely sliced shrimp, crushed and sliced peanuts, lime juice, a bit of parsley maybe. Simple and tasty.

I had the server coach me on the pronunciation of the soup I ordered. Despite that, the wrong soup was served. I got what I think was the Hue-style beef noodle soup. I went with it, unwisely. The noodles were overly soft, the pieces of stew meat elaborately swaddled in fat.

Nice VN music was playing, the shady, quiet interior more pleasant than you would expect. The graceful server had the quality of many of her co-nationals: She made the average American woman look like Larry the Cable Guy in drag.

How does this place have a "People Love Us on Yelp" sticker? It should say, "People concede we're probably trying."
author: John H.

description: Pho Nice catered a grand opening event that I attended and the food was fantastic!  So even though I haven't been to the actual restaurant I wanted to leave a review.  The spring rolls were fantastic and beautifully presented!  I'll definitely make a point to get over there so I can try more of the menu.
author: Jenifer M.

description: Had the grilled pork and imperial rolls bún and the pho. For almost $9 the bún was such a tiny portion size I was still hungry. The grilled pork was blah but the imperial roll was delicious. The bún didn't really have anything besides the shredded lettuce and the grilled pork, imperial rolls and noodles kinda weird. The pho was huge portion and with decent seasoning. Service was very slow and the place wasn't that busy and the waitress forgot about the sprite I ordered until after the meal was finish and was paying for the meal. First time here might come back for the imperial rolls or maybe not. Was very so so place.
author: Betsy X.

description: The food wasn't horrible..... But the pho did not come with basil or bean sprouts. And they used flat rice noodles... Thet also charge a fee for orders less than $15 if using debit/credit. I would not recommend this place.
author: Irwin S.

description:
Pros: great tasty pho+ you get alotta steak when you order 'sliced steak'+ great egg noodles (i never order white)

Cons: they dont serve sprouts+ theres only one size for pho bowls.
Those are the only two reasons for taking 2 stars off. The service is a bit slow, but it's obvious that its a little family business and hope to see it get bigger

Piss off: to those who go there for the first time and order something other than pho. Its a pho spot genius
author: Adam B.

description:
On those days when the city goes bipolar on you, turning from sunny-skies-and-75 to cloudy-and-windy all in the same day, I like to keep warm any way I can. With my big puffy jacket on and the heater at full blast in the S.O.'s car, we made our way to this little restaurant in Outer Mission for some Vietnamese food.

As we approached the restaurant, I realized we had been here before about a year back. It turns out that new owners run the place and did a few upgrades (specifically, to the menu and interior)! Food and service was still just as good as I had remembered it.

Food/Drink: 
-Shrimp spring rolls: can't go wrong with these. Came with four large rolls. Fresh ingredients and de-veined shrimp! I love the attention to this. One thing to note is that the picture on their menu is not how it looks like when you order it, so don't get your hopes up. I would suggest showing how the real dish appears on the menu, or make the dish the way it is shown in the menu.
-Grilled chicken rice plate: S.O. loved it. Comes with grilled chicken w/o the skin, dipping sauce/soup, rice, and veggies.
-Pho w/ rare steak: Flavorful! Plenty of meat and noodles. I did notice there were no bean sprouts though, which I wish they could include since that's what most Vietnamese restaurants offer and since this dish is a little bit more expensive compared to others (~$8).
-Thai iced tea: Sweet treat throughout dinner. =)

A few other suggestions would be to update their menu. It set us a little off seeing how pen marks were made to increase the price for certain dishes. Maybe it's a money saving thing, but it looks more professional to not see those type of errors or even realizing the dish is now more expensive than it was before. Also, fixing up the exterior since we noticed a few plants dying.

Overall, quality Vietnamese dishes that definitely reminded us of some similar establishments in SoCal. I am sure they are still trying to make improvements...but the food hits the spot!
author: Loriel L.

description:
Delicious Northern Vietnamese cuisine, hold the bean sprouts. YAY!

LOCATION:
Corner of Geneva & Mission, next to Popeye's (HORRIBLE parking but worth the journey).

RECOMMENDATION:
Fresh Spring Rolls in lieu of infamous Imperial Rolls that sell out quick (like today). Wings = 5pc / order. Refreshing Shrimp & Papaya Salad. Tasty special order of shrimp noodle soup (not on the menu but ask & they'll accommodate). 

VERDICT:
Our 1st time here won't be our last! 

PROTIP:
Save yourself time & call ahead! Credit cards accepted.
author: Geminyna J.

description: Food was ok, service was fine. Food not what I expected, they skimped on the veggie pho dish and didn't provide the meal with good amount of veggies or variety- only had bok choy and carrots. I asked for the sprouts and mint and arugula and lime and I got very little portion of that. Lime was old and bitter. Low quality and I will not go back and definitely will steer friends away. The icing on the cake was when I called to place the order.  After I ordered my ONE pho veggie soup for a tots of $9.00 I specifically asked if they were cash only and they stated they took cards too.  When I arrived they said there was a $15 minimum and I had to incur an extra fee for using my debit card. This wasn't shared on the phone and frustrated me with regards to the service. Gave them two stars because they were polite regardless of the unpleasant quality overall.
author: Alexis C.

description:
Before complaining about the noodles, people should get that this is ha noi style pho so that's how the noodle is supposes to be. 

This is a small family restaurant so it does lack some quality in service.

The food is above average so 4 stars out of 5, price is fair since there is a lot. Kinda too much for my girlfriend, so maybe it would be good if they offer different sizes. 

Overall this is a pretty good place and would come back whenever I want pho.
author: Jake Z.

description:
Nice local place, been coming here regularly since they opened.  It's new and whenever I visit it's been nice and clean inside.  They're doing a free soda thing 
They have a good beef soup (Bun Bo Hue) and the Clear noodle chicken soup (lightly ginger with shiitake mushrooms) really hit the spot when I was sick.  The pho is decent.

I like the customer service, they give me extra garlic when I ask.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I love this Vietnamese restaurant! I've had the vegetarian pho and the spring rolls. Their menu is very traditional and reminds me of my own mother's cooking. 
Prices are great and the food is consistently good. The neighborhood isn't the best but I would eat here versus Popeye's any day.
author: Ash H.

description:
The food is solid. The pho is Hanoi-style so no basil, beansprouts and tripe, but the broth and other meats on the pho are good. The other dishes such as imperial rolls (fried minced pork rolls) and bun bo hue (spicy beef noodle soup) are also good. I am Vietnamese and this is probably my favorite pho place in the Mission, Noe, Excelsior area. It is not a destination spot, but if you are in the area and craving some Vietnamese food, it is a good place to try. 

P.S. It is near a very busy intersection so parking can be challenging.
author: D. P.

description:
There aren't a lot of quality Vietnamese restaurants in the San Francisco area. The gold mine of Vietnamese restaurants is in San Jose, no doubt. But, alas, I live here and crave Vietnamese food.

I ordered the bun bo hue, which I know whenever a restaurant is named "pho something" you might want to just stick to the pho. I ordered the BBH anyway because I was craving it and wanted to try this place out.

Parking is difficult around the restaurant and I came on a weekend, so there was almost nobody there. The bun bo hue was oilier than I'm used to and it was only so-so. I've definitely had better in San Jose. I guess it quenched my hunger for bun bo hue, but I wasn't super satisfied.

Not sure if I'd come back.
author: Peggy C.

description: I feel very lucky to live near such a great Vietnamese place. I always used to love getting Pho as a kid in Southern California and I think the steak, chicken, and shrimp dishes are phenomenal. I love Sriracha and adding a bunch to make the soup even better. The Thai iced tea helps to quench the thirst and sooth the Sriracha burn. I am sad that this place only has 3 stars. i suppose the service could be better, but the food is amazing. The people are always friendly and for the most part the place is usually empty.
author: Robert M.

description:
I couldn't pass up on a restaurant with such a "nice" name so we circled around the neighborhood at least a dozen time on a weekday to find parking. 

Service was very slow. There was only one waitress and she looked like she needed a nap. Poor girl was dragging her feet to and from the five tables.

We ordered their appetizer platter and pho. Not typical Vietnamese -- it had some kind of twang but not in a bad way. The food was good but not 4-star good. 

It wasn't worth the drive or hassle of finding parking. It seemed to be a "nice" place to stop by for the folks that live nearby though.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Just moved into the area and seeing the score of 3 made me wonder - but a friend said it was good. Today I had the beef stew soup with eggnoodles and it was delicious. My group all enjoyed their food as well. Service was solid. Holding back on a higher score till I try it again.
author: Steve G.

description:
Great food.
Terrible service.

They brought me the wrong soup.

Waiter told me no water because there's no ice? 

One time I got water and it was warm.

The table next to me had one person with food allergy's. Well evidently their server didn't even know what the word "peanuts" meant. This could be a major deal breaker for many. 

Oh yea and they don't have ice water but  serve tea ...

They need to stop enlisting family members as staff and hire a REAL waiter.

The food is good but the business lacks management 
Sorry 3 stars
author: Matteo C.

description:
I feel bad giving a low rating because the staff is sweet. But seriously, the pho here is pathetic. It's not about North Vietnamese style or South Vietnamese style - it's just bad. 

The coffee is way overpriced, too.
author: S. A. K.

description:
I've been coming here for the past two years, and each time I visit I order the vegetarian pho and always ask if it's vegetarian out of habit and am always assured yes it is. Today when I asked I was informed that their "vegetarian" pho is NOT vegetarian and has always been made with chicken broth! They've been serving chicken broth as a vegetarian dish!

I'm disappointed at being assured over and over that a dish is vegetarian only to find out that it never was. Disappointed to say the least.
author: Laura A.

description: Pho, bun chu Ha Noi and Bun Bo Hue were very flavorful! Highly recommend if you are looking for original Vietnamese taste!
author: Anh Thu D.

description:
When you walk in its kind of an awkward set up. Chairs to your left and right, but seating is only on the left. I came here on a Saturday afternoon and no one else was here. Again, I just came to scope out my new neighborhood. The prices were high for a pho restaurant, no wonder no one was there. I'm used to my $5-6 bowl, but this bowl was $8, and all I had was rare steak. In fairness, the bowl was a little bigger than most, I couldn't finish it! 

My roommate ordered their fried spring roll vermicelli and got pork vermicelli. She had to wait a very long time to get the waitress' attention because she was busy on her laptop. When she mentioned she received the wrong order because she ordered spring roll vermicelli, the waitress proceeded to tell her she didn't, and that she ordered pork. My roommate doesn't even like pork...Eventually her order was changed and you could evidently see they just took the pork out and added spring rolls (sauce all over the edge of the dish). :/

Pros: Fried spring rolls are yum.

VERY IMPORTANT UPDATE:
Not the best service or prices in town, but I have come back because of the proximity. Nothing really spectacular. Also, prices have gone up yet again. Wth. Menu said $7.90, yet when the bill came we were charged $8.50. Pho MEAN of them. That was shady, and if I wasnt tired, they wouldnt have heard the end of it. I won't be coming back after that. Still 2 stars for those imperial rolls. Only those.
author: April M.

description: I was a little disappointed in the overall taste of the pho. I really like Kevin's Noodle House on 19th and Irving, and this was not at all on the same level. I was told that basil and sprouts is not traditionally served with pho, so that was a bummer. They did not have many options to make my broth spicy other than the jalapeños served on the side. Overall I would go back only if I was in the area and did not want to drive to Kevin's Noodle House on 19th and Irving or the one at Westlake in Daly City.
author: Diego L.

description:
Had a terrible experience the other day (and the evening after) when I decided to give Pho Nice a try. My bowl of pho, while generously sized, was literally nothing but broth, noodles, and a bit of meat. The broth had an interesting hint of coconut flavor, but was otherwise disappointingly bland, and the lack of basil, bean sprouts, and other common pho accompaniments didn't help. Perhaps this is simply "North Vietnamese style,"  but bland is bland in my book. The noodles were also a bit overcooked, but I could have overlooked that had the taste been up to par.
 
They conveniently forgot to mention up front that credit card transactions under $10 would be charged a 50 cent fee. Being short on cash and late for my bus, I had little choice but to pay up. In retrospect I'm not sure why I even bothered to leave a tip. 

Oh yes, lest I forget, after dining at Pho Nice, I was woken up in the middle of the night by a searing stomachache. Connecting the dots is left as an exercise to the reader.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: My favorite! Love this place! They have a different taste and the best imperial rolls in town so we always get two orders. Nice servers as well. Don't let parking discourage you! Find one.
author: Angeline B.

description:
We'll upon reading the previous reviews I was a bit sketchy about coming to is place but I decided to give it a try.  Given that this place is northern style Vietnamese cuisine it is going to be a bit different than other pho places.  Over all I have to say the food is good.  The fried spring rolls are good and my pho had a good amount of meat and the broth was good, although it was a bit mild compared to other places which isn't bad but a nice change.

I'm giving this place three stars not entirely based on the food but the service sucks bad.  Our server came to take our order with no pen or pad, which I didn't care because I assumed he probably had a good memory.  But after one of our dishes came the server came back and asked what else I order again.  Server forgot our drinks and it was difficult getting refills of water.  Biggest thing was after I asked for the bill he server passed our table three times and didn't bother taking the check.  Finally i just walked it up since I was in a hurry to leave.  I would be forgiving of this if was extremely busy but it wasn't.  I hate to reduce a rating because of service however it is a review on the entire aspect of the restaurant.
author: Leon L.

description:
Honestly, I would give this place no stars. First off my girlfriend and I came in, nobody greeted us. We had to look for someone to seat us and take our order. Not only that but he looked dirty as hell. Really, this guy wore slippers with his dirty ass feet. I already felt disgusted. What made it worse was that he didn't understand what we really ordered so we just pointed at what we wanted. 
Now on to the food, my pho order was not on point... It really tasted cheap... LIKE REALLY CHEAP. No matter how much I added on to it, it still wasn't good enough. I could've had made ramen instead and saved me a 7-9 dollars. Anyways 2/3's into my bowl I found a bug in my bowl... Yeah A BUG IN MY BOWL. I felt like I had a day old pho bowl. 
The only good part was my girlfriends order. The grilled pork chop rice plate. But other than that, this place is not worth it at all. I would rather go to Westlake. At least their food and service is better. Even if some of the servers/waiters didn't really speak English they still understood what you're ordering at least.
author: Patrick G.

description: Parking is a bit difficult during dinner time  due to the Mission St construction. I was worried about the slow service but it wasn't that bad when we went. The older lady working the register was also the same one taking our orders and serving which may result in slow service. I ordered the Hanoi style pho while the bf ordered the bun cha. I couldn't tell the difference between the Hanoi style or the most common style Pho. The broth was the same, aside from it not being served with bean sprouts, lime and herbs. There was a lot of meat I give them that. The bun cha was also good, 2 meat patties with grilled pork and a good amount of vermicelli noodles and herbs. It's a good place to eat if you are in the area but not a place I would drive out of my way to.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description:
Are you pho-real?

I came here for the first time last week and was not digging the quality of the pho they had here. Or maybe it could it be the one I ordered in general sucked. Whatever the issue, I had the beef pho and it wasn't that great. I had better beef pho and this one wasn't meeting my expectations! - Come on! I want to get pho'cked up, dude!
author: Lauren Y.

description: The food taste so good and the price is pretty cool and the service is nice. I ordered rice noodles and shrimp fried rice
author: Minsun P.

description: Gross waste of money, it literally was the worst Pho of my life. Slimy cold noodles, lukewarm flavorless broth, just nasty.
author: Sneakrs 1.

description:
If you want good Vietnamese food in this neighborhood, this place is the way to go. Everything here is solid and you will probably not be disappointed. However, on the same note, most things are not super extraordinary. But that's okay. I will say the pho is pretty damn tasty. 

We all know Asian restaurants are usually not known for awesome customer service, but this place was fantastic and super friendly! It actually made this place more memorable for me. Oh, and it seems clean. 

Also, I noticed I get way more food when I dine in versus take out.
author: Justin C.

description:
Pretty bomb Bo Bun Hieu ; forgive if anything isn't spelled correctly. Spicy with a not if sourness to it.

Spring rolls are different ; less rice but more ruff age ~ enjoying the spinach and cucumber or apple on it - not sure which they put

A regular Vietnamese spot for me and the folk and friends .

Come through!!
author: Brad L.

description:
Easily my new favorite pho place. I live closer to Pho Ha Tien on Ocean Ave, but I am definitely making the longer walk to Pho Nice whenever a craving for pho hits. Why? Because the soup was pho-nomenal!

I got the spicy beef noodle soup, which was extremely flavorful (I could taste chile, lime, fish sauce, beef) and not too spicy. The soup also came with a fair amount of meat and was a really good portion size. 

The other two people I came with both got the pho. They both highly enjoyed their soup and said the broth was extremely flavorful.

Service was very nice although a little slower than expected considering the restaurant was empty when we ate here. Nonetheless, we will definitely be back!
author: Wendy S.

description: Who knew this little spot on the corner of Geneva and Mission would be a gem?  Dropped in to pick up dinner before hitting up a community event.  Damn, yes!  Papaya salad on point.  Tofu noodle soup filled cravings.  Warm tea to help with digestion.  Whenever I'm in Excelsior with a grumbling tummy, I know where to go for clean eating :)
author: melissa n.

description:
5 STARS!  It isn't spectacular, but does it look spectacular?  No, so 5 stars it gets!  

I come here all the time, and their pho bowls are very large for $8.  I have recently started ordering things besides pho and  really like their fried rice with chicken.  Honestly, their egg noodles with shrimp was really plain and the noodles and shrimp did not coexist very well at all.  It looked like noodles with a few shrimps on top and not a coherent dish.  Lastly, their Vietnamese ice tea is refreshing and only costs 90 cents.
author: Bill V.

description:
I have went there every week for 4 months, I like the food. I purchase the same thing all the time and paid the same price.The people have always been very nice, clean and professional.
Yesterday I went in and a new waitress came to help me, I never saw her before. She took my order and asked me to pay immediately, I said in a very nice and soft tone, I have I always  paid when I received my order.
I left to shop a few doors down as I waited for Pho Nice to prepare my order as I have always done. When I returned about 10 minutes later, I could see her looking threw the window for me and exhaled as I entered. 
She told me my order was ready, however she gave a different price from what I had been paying for the same food for 4 months. and there is no price on the menu.
I felt the need to ask, Did you raise your prices ?. She said yes a few months ago. I said, I have been buying for four months and the price was always the same.
She started speaking  loudly in Vietnamese to other people working in the restaurant creating a disturbance. I just wanted to know why the price difference, I felt it was only normal to ask.  Immediately the workers that have served me before came from the kitchen area and 
they discussed it in Vietnamese.
After they finished, ( the EVIL  lady said to me: we are charging you for the extra sauce ). I said I have always got extra sauce. She turned to them again and spoke in Vietnamese and turned back to me and said ( THEY SAID YOU WERE A GREAT CUSTOMER AND COME ALL THE TIME). I said, am I not the same great customer and I am here right now. 
She got angry with me and said. ( I AM FROM CORPORATE OFFICE AND YOU PAY) she further stated , (I AM NOT MY SISTER, I AM DIFFERENT). 
 I told her that at least 3 or 4 other persons have served me before and they never asked for me to pay for extra sauce, specialty when I was purchasing 4 dinners. Her sister and all the other workers has been professional every time, If I had been asked to pay extra by them, I would have payed it. Plus I always leave a tip up to $ 5.00 and it is always to go.
 SO! my question still remains the same. was I not a great customer any more ? and if I had sat down to eat at the table, would they have charged me for 1 oz's of sauce? even if I am buying dinner for 4 people.
I did pay the extra for the sauce, I was embarrassed for the workers . She treated them as if they were worthless. 
I did not give a tip this time and as I left, the (EVIL CORPORATE SISTER) left with a frown on her face. Maybe she is in the wrong business. and should leave it up to the other family members like her sister and stay in the corporate office.
I end my statement by saying, the food is great but the Corporate Office (SISTER) is not PHO NICE. SHE WAS VERY RUDE, LOUD AND SPEAKING IN VIETNAMESE AND DRAWING ATTENTION FROM EVEN THE CUSTOMERS EATING.

I WILL NOT BE BACK.
PHO NICE WAS NOT SO NICE.
author: Shirley I.

description: Not my kind of PHO i'm used to. They use thick, flat rice noodles instead of the usual thin, rice noodles, over priced for pho and that location, combo beef noodle is $7.80 and only one size compared to $5-$7.50 range at other restaurants where they have bowl size options. Although the staff is nice and quaint. Parking is limited.
author: Vic A.

description:
Another Reason why I'm Still CHUBBY! This Place is Really Good! I like that this place is in the Excelsior!...    Unfortunately there is a lack of Great Food in EXR, but it is Slowly changing with Places like THIS!! 

Their Seafood PHO is NOT GREASY!  Which I LOVE and the Fresh Spring Rolls are the BOMB! :)
author: Alfonso C.

description: I ordered a spicy Pho and it was yummy! I don't think it was spicy enough though, but overall yummy!
author: Gloria M.

description:
The bun and appetizers are good. The pho is not as good. They used frozen beef, and chinese rice noodles instead of the vietnamese kind. 

They're really nice though, gave me a whole plate of extra veggies, when I asked, and another time, I stopped in to see if they had any cilantro I could just buy, and they gave me some for free. They also always play Rush Hour, Shrek, or have Jeopardy on the tv.
author: Lilian K.

description: open relatively late, spring rolls were good, but they did not have that leek tied to the outside like in other pics, chicken shrimp pho had good soup and good noodle texture, but the chicken was bland and rough texture, pork over rice was flavorful
author: Long C.

description: I ordered some spring rolls and a bowl of phó. Both dishes came with nice long strains of hair. Bon appetite!
author: Hayk N.

description: Pho here is ok, meat in it was thinly cut. Imperial rolls were good. Would I go back...?? No, thank you.
author: Selene P.

description: If I were to use one word to describe the quality of pho here I would use: abysmal. The pho beef stew I had was by far the blandest and worse pho ive had. The pho itself looked lazily made, with the stew being watery. It seemed more of a guess attempt than something someone experienced in making pho would serve. Also minimum on card is $15. Terrible experience never coming back.
author: Dean S.

description: Love the broth in their chicken pho; it saved my life when I was sick a few days ago! And they're so nice! I dropped and spilled one of my broth containers on the way to my car, and they replaced it for free.
author: krissa l.

description: Good cheap Pho! Recommend the rare beef pho. Appears to be a good place for families, as they had a large TV with old tom and jerry cartoons on, i had a hard time peeling my eyes off.
author: ellen m.

description: Their pho is great, but I was highly disappointed by the thai iced tea, tasted like sugar water. I took one sip and asked if I could return it. They said no. Terrible costumer service for that.
author: Rebekah W.

description:
This is one of the few places in the San Francisco area where you can eat Northern-Style Pho. (Called Pho Ha Noi here)

Pho is actually a dish from North Vietnam but since most Vietnamese here in the US are from the South, chances are that you will be served the Southern variant.

The soup is not as sweet and the noodles are wider. Also, there are no bean sprouts served with the herbs. 

I've tried some other places nearby but so far, this is the best. If like Northern Style Pho or want to try something new, this place is definitely worth a try!

I wished you guys would open till late night~
author: Sergio S.

description: I really don't like Vietnamese food. Nasty!!! I went cause my wifey loves the stuff. It was what I thought it would be, greasy, no flavor, smelly and everything tasted the same!!! Hopeful I will not be back!!! No stars if I could!!!
author: Armando S.

description: For Pho, they really have it wrong. They don't give bean sprouts, and all of their sauces are bottled, not fresh. I ordered chicken pho and it was sub-par. I will, however give points for the imperial rolls- they were great. They staff was friendly but didn't speak English, so communication was hard. Overall, I would get my pho somewhere else. I will not return.
author: Stephanie F.

description: This place is not bad if you are dying to satisfy your pho cravings.  However the prices are pretty high.  Total for a pho is around $8.50 and more if you order others. The pho ga is not bad and their bun bo hue is good (the flavors are there) but the beef slices were a bit chewy.  The spring rolls are a pass since there's apple slices to it.  The rice plates are okay, not the best grilled pork chop out there.
author: Ann L.

description: I just don't know why they don't try to do something to improve the quality for the food. Price is weigh too high already , why still not service better food to the customers. It's very interesting that they said the real Vietnamese pho not supposed come with bean sprouts . Well! So many ppl haven't been to Vietnam , but as already a image to San Francisco ppl while so many other restaurants service with bean sprouts, isn't it ridiculous?
author: Babebaby Z.

description: Waste of money!!! Pho was not "pho"... What?! It was a decent size but they didn't have the rice noodles I was expecting. It was the thick and white noodles. sigh. The broth was pretty bland .. & there was only a few piece of beef zzz. And the rest was noodles
author: Anna Y.

description:
i will admit pho nice isn't the best pho you'll ever have BUT.... it's still pretty damn good to me. all of their other food is delicious as well; you can't go wrong with the rice plates or fried rice. 

i usually order some type of beef pho; rare steak or the combination one. i always ask for extra noodles because i feel like they don't give enough and it's only $0.50 extra. the broth isn't too oily or salty; i think it's pretty good. it tastes like it doesn't have MSG which i'm thankful for. 

the only downside is that they are a little expensive (my pho comes out to around $10 with tip if i'm by myself) but i live closer to pho nice than pho ha tien down on ocean. i prefer pho nice unless i want a banh mi.
author: Alyssa L.

description:
I just don't get what all the other reviewers are talking about! Those other reviewers seem to either be friends of the owner/staff of the place or just picked out customers that are insisted to write a review. I have been here when the ownership of the restaurant had changed. Because I live nearby, I hoped to find a decent place to eat during my lazy days. So on one lazy day of mine, I decided to come here and give the new owners a try. Boy was I wrong! This place is HORRIFYING and DISGUSTING. 

I ordered the imperial rolls and the regular combination pho. The imperial rolls are decent, it seemed like they were copying the ones from places like cheesecake factory or something. The worst part was the pho. Beef pho with a super weird tasting broth. It was nasty! The beef were like dried, ripped random pieces with very few meatballs, maybe 2 quarters, I forgot. The pho/noodles................damn......it was clumped together so bad that it was even impossible to separate them without breaking all of it in little strands, even in the hot, weird broth! Wth...I felt like their noodles technically were sitting in small portions in the kitchen for a very, VERY long time. 

That girl that works there think that anything I say is just bull crap and kept comparing their food with the previous owner's food. It is so nasty when she came out showing me the food from the freezer that belonged to the previous owner! She even admitted that they have taken over the restaurant since 5-6 months ago! She came out admitting that they still keep the previous owner's egg rolls, their wraps, and many other foods kept/prepped in the freezer. Talk about disgusting! Seriously, people, DO NOT COME HERE! You don't even know what food they are serving you! Because I always walk by here and the business of the previous owner was very sad, they didn't have much business, and you can imagine how much old food they would have kept and sold to these new owners, Pho Nice. After knowing what types of food they kept back there just made me lose my appetite, not that the food was gonna be good anyways. Old food being stored with new food will cause cross contamination and worse, you won't even know what they are serving is new or old or just a mixture. If you care about your health and food quality when you go to a restaurant, DO NOT COME HERE!!! Especially, not like their food taste good anyways. 

YOU GUYS HAVE BEEN WARNED! =)

Oh yea, I forgot to mention, they have been using the previous owner's menus when I was there and all of their bad reviews went to the previous owner since they did NOT have their own logo/restaurant name displayed at a visible place. You can search for Pho Hoa Hop which is the same address and look at their recent reviews which are all 1 starred.
author: Eurayle L.

description: I went here last week with a friend, and we were just trying to look for something for lunch. It was somewhat empty but it allowed us to carry on our conversations. I ordered the rare steak pho along with some spring rolls. The spring rolls were definitely on point as well as the pho... wasn't the best pho I had but it wasn't as bad as the people that described it in the bottom reviews. I would come back here again.
author: Victor L.

description: The Pho broth was the best I have ever had and their Imperial rolls were really good.
author: Y D.

description: I LOVE IT HERE! I used to go here when the old management was there and the recipe for the food is still the same (which is awesome!) I always get the pho and its always so flavorful :) But the weird thing is, every time I go there and get pho they never have bean sprouts. Isn't it normal to have bean sprouts in a Vietnamese restaurant?
author: Annie K.

description: I live in the neighborhood adjacent to Ingleside, so I usually go to the Vietnamese restaurant on Ocean.  I often pass by Pho Nice but I'm never in any need to try it out.  I did today, however.  The food was overpriced and low quality.  I enjoy supporting all local businesses in my neighborhood but unfortunately Pho Nice will not be one of them.  The vermicelli plate is very below average.  Minimal effort was put into the sliced vegetables and the pork was fatty to the point that it was inedible--not to mention incredibly salty. Not recommended.
author: Amber R.

description: Ill say this first off the noodles use for the pho were like fettuccine noodles wtf? the broth was like something Ive never tasted in a pho place, not saying it was nasty it was a nice broth but it damn sure wasnt pho. Now the ultimate upset was the fact that they had the nerve to say the don't carry bean sprouts? WTF and the only condiments where some massacred cilantro and a damn lemon? Dude GTFOH! I think Ive said enough here good effing bye!
author: Fanon P.

description: Definitely my spot when I'm craving Vietnamese. The grilled shrimp vermicelli is the best! (Love how they clean the shrimp. I'm so OCD about that.) And my friends always get the beef pho because the broth is definitely quality. Highly recommended.
author: M E.

description: I ordered bun no hue and there was no pig blood which was odd cause I thought it was authentic Vietmese food.
author: Simon W.

description: First of all I got the shits 5 minutes after i left the place. the beef is disgustingly thick. the noodles are all balled up. and when i got the check i noticed the lady raised the price (not what the menu said). all great reviews are phony.
author: Sofia L.

description: Most authentic Veitnamese food in the Bay Area! The imperial rolls are incredible!!
author: Kira X.

description:
Terrible pho. Noodles were over cooked and falling apart, broth was too salty with very little flavor, didn't come with a side of fresh bean sprout because they "don't have it".  

What you do mean you "don't have it", did you run out or are all other Vietnamese restaurants are wrong to serve pho with bean sprouts. 

We didn't expect much service, at least that lived up to our expectations.
author: J S.

description: Comfort Food :) Very cozy & nice specially on cold weather. Very friendly & fast customer service .. Feels like home
author: Leann S.

description: Awesome + very friendly place. Family atmosphere. We stay here for 2-3hrs to eat, hangout, study the bible and not only do they not trip but they're super friendly.
author: kenobi c.

description: Since I love eating Bun Bo Hue, BF told me to try this place because they had the best bbh according to his experience.... mmMm... nope. Such small portion and the noodles were FALLING apart... I should really just grab a needle and inject my noodle crumbs directly into my stomach. Three stars for fast service and also nice staff. Maybe I will give it another try someday (:
author: Annie Y.

description: Very good Pho, good flavor and very generous with the meat portions. A little bit on the pricey side but worth it for the quality and cleanliness of the restaurant. Hard to find parking due to the area. Overall very good lunch.
author: Ronette B.

description: Good customer service, but when they are busy your order might come out funny! So beware!!
author: Jessica N.

description: I had only 30 minutes to eat so my daughter and I ordered the Garlic Noodles $5.60.  Unbelievable!!!  The order was large enough for both of us and the taste was better than to PPQ on Clement!  Best deal ever!
author: Linda Y.

description: i really wanted to like this place but i asked specifically for the rice noodles in the beef noodles soup, instead i got the fatter round kinds which i didn't like. i didn't want to ask them to take it back because i hate wasting food but i told the server several times and he said ok and wrote it down. a bit frustrated at the experience.
author: Tiff W.

description: Worst pho i ever had, and dont even have the regular noodles, crap, money wasted, and im the only one here, should of seen that and wonder.
author: Nam D.

description: The noodles were the wide kind, the broth was ok, and the beef, while rare (which is good), was too thick and chewy.  Add that to the price, it wasn't the greatest experience.  They did give a lot of iced milk coffee though, so that was good.
author: Kryzak K.

description: So far only had imperial roll and pork chop. Both were delicious. Especially the imperial roll. Will be back again for sure.
author: Vu L.

description: A great quick place to go for some reasonably priced Pho.  Nice service and easy to get into.  The make a variety from the North, so don't expect the usual items such as bean sprouts, basil, etc.
author: Cheryl J.
